author: Dan Kilpatrick, Tottenham correspondent
title: Tottenham knew of Pochettino's meeting with Barcelona chief - source
text:
about an hour ago Tottenham knew of Pochettino's meeting with Barcelona chief - source The Tottenham net-minder talks up the team's hopes to qualify for the UCL again, and their vision for league success. 
Tottenham Hotspur were aware of manager Mauricio Pochettino's meeting with Barcelona president Josep Maria Bartomeu in Spain this week, a source has told ESPN FC, with the get-together increasing speculation he is a contender to become the La Liga club's next coach. 
The source at Tottenham said Pochettino and Bartomeu have been friends for years, and that the club knew of the meeting in a central Barcelona restaurant. 
Current Barcelona coach Luis Enrique has announced that he will step down at the end of the current campaign, but the club remain in contention to retain the title in La Liga and win the Champions League. 
Pochettino spent 10 years as a player and coach with Barcelona's local rivals Espanyol, and he owns a property in the city, where both of his sons were born. Mauricio Pochettino has been linked with the Barcelona job. 
However, he has previously said that he was "born with a bull on his arm," in reference to his affection for Espanyol, and has even described Barcelona as his "sporting enemy." 
Pochettino has turned Tottenham into Premier League title contenders since joining from Southampton in 2014, and he signed a new five-year contract in May before guiding them to a club-record third-place finish in the Premier League. 
Asked about speculation he could manage Barcelona shortly before Luis Enrique announced his departure last month, Pochettino said: "I can't say anything. I'm at Tottenham. I am very happy, [I have] four more years of my contract, enjoying an exciting project. It's true it's not an easy project, but I'm very happy here." 
Dan is ESPN FC's Tottenham correspondent. Follow him on Twitter: @Dan_KP.
